sentences: Pääsed sisse ainult üle minu surnukeha!
context: The Estonian word 'surnukeha' is a compound noun formed from 'surnu' (meaning dead) + 'keha' (meaning body). It refers to the physical remains of a deceased person. This word has various forms in different grammatical cases, with the plural form being 'surnukehad'. In Estonian grammar, it follows declension patterns typical for nouns ending in '-a'.
